author: rooneg
msg: * tags/0.10
use the magic subversion time machine to retroactively tag version 0.10.

author: cmpilato
msg: * subversion/mod_dav_svn/log.c
(log_receiver): Oops.  Fix a bug (ya know, one of those
last-minute-edit bugs...)

author: cmpilato
msg: Finish Issue #811.
* subversion/include/svn_types.h
(svn_log_changed_path_t): New.
(svn_log_message_receiver_t): Change docstring.
* subversion/libsvn_repos/log.c
(detect_changed): Use 'M' for modify, not 'U'.  Use new
svn_log_changed_path_t structures in the returned hash, and check
for copy history on adds and replaces.
* subversion/mod_dav_svn/log.c
(log_receiver): Use new svn_log_changed_path_t structures from hash,
sending copyfrom information back to the client where it exists.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_dav/ra_dav.h
(enum): Add ELEM_replaced_path.  Change ELEM_changed_path to
ELEM_modified_path.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_dav/fetch.c
(get_attr): Minor tweak to prevent segfault when used where no
attributes are present.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_dav/log.c
(struct log_baton): Add 'this_path_item'.
(svn_ra_dav__get_log): Add support for ELEM_replaced_path and update
support for ELEM_modified_path.
(get_attr): New (copied from fetch.c, including the above tweak).
(log_start_element): Read attributes for the changed-path log items.
(log_end_element): Put the 'this_path_item' in the log baton into
the changed_paths hash.
* subversion/clients/cmdline/log-cmd.c
(log_message_receiver): Print copyfrom info returned from `svn log'.

author: sussman
msg: Fix segfault.  (Was happening with 'svn switch' was run with no args.)
* switch-cmd.c (svn_cl__switch): this code assumes that targets->nelts
must be either 1 or 2.  of course, it would help if our initial test
actually *enforces* this condition!

author: sussman
msg: Fix issue #709: "MKACTIVITY does not properly return errors".
Wehn repository perms were messed up and mod_dav_svn couldn't write to
its private activity dbm files, then no error was returned.  So the
client's attempt to use the activity would fail:
The specified activity does not exist.
Now a real error is returned when the activity can't be created:
failed to open activity db;  check repos perms.
* activity.c (dav_svn_store_activity):  return a real error if we
can't open or close the dbm files in repos/dav/.
